channel.title: LLMs on Rotational Labs
channel.description: Recent content in LLMs on Rotational Labs

item.title: Making Sense of LLMs
item.description: Now that we’ve covered agents at a high level and prompts specifically, let’s move to the next component in our series: Large Language Models (LLMs), a key subset of generative AI. In an agentic framework, LLMs serve as the “brain” or decision-execution component of the agent.

item.title: Let The Right One In: Model Selection for the AI Era
item.description: There’s no “best AI model for all use cases.” You have to do the science each time. If you’re new to experimental design for AI/ML, here’s a quick and dirty intro to the Model Selection Triple methodology.

item.title: Recapping PyTorch: Key Takeaways from the 2024 Conference
item.description: I spent last week in San Francisco meeting up with the Rotational team to attend PyTorch Conference. If you’re an LLM developer and didn’t make it this year, here are some of my key highlights and takeaways.

item.title: Teaching LLMs With Continuous Human Feedback
item.description: If you’ve worked with generative AI models you know they can be fickle and sometimes fail to meet the expectations of users. How can we move towards models users trust and see clear value in? Let’s engineer a user-feedback loop!

item.title: To LLM or Not to LLM (Part 2): Starting Simple
item.description: Sick of hearing about hyped up AI solutions that sound like hot air? 🧐 Let’s use boring old ML to detect hype in AI marketing text and see why starting with a simple ML approach is still your best bet 90% of the time.

item.title: To LLM or Not to LLM: Tips for Responsible Innovation
item.description: We’re seeing a proliferation of Large Language Models (LLMs) as companies seek to replicate OpenAI’s success. In this post, two AI engineers respond to LLM FAQs and offer tips for responsible innovation.

item.title: Predicting the Oscars With LLMs
item.description: Looking for a middle ground between custom LLMs and traditional ML? Please welcome semantic search to the stage! Let’s use semantic search to predict which film will take home the “Best Picture” Oscar this year 🤩
